Berharap Keringanan Sanksi, Persebaya Resmi Ajukan Banding ke PSSI
04 Nov 2019, 19:25 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Manajemen Persebaya Surabaya resmi mengajukan banding ke Komite Banding (komding) PSSI. Tim kebanggaan Arek Suroboyo tersebut mengharapkan keringan sanksi atas insiden kericuhan pada laga kontra PSS Sleman.
Berdasarkan keputusan komdis PSSI tertanggal 31 Oktober 2019, Persebaya mendapat hukuman bermain tanpa suporter hingga akhir musim. Green Force juga harus membayar denda Rp. 200 juta.
"Hari ini kami mengirimkan surat banding ke sekjen PSSI dan juga ke komisi banding," kata Manajer Persebaya, Chandra Wahyudi kepada Bola.net, Senin (4/11/2019).
Dikatakan Chandra, dalam nota banding, pihaknya menjelaskan secara rinci kronologi kericuhan. Termasuk langkah-langkah yang dilakukan manajemen sebelum dan sesudah kericuhan.
"Pertama, faktanya memang ada kerusuhan di pertandingan lawan PSS, itu tidak bisa dibantah, dan publik sudah sangat tahu dan clear kalau memang ada peristiwa kekerasan di sana," lanjut Chandra.
"Yang kedua, kami memaparkan kepada PSSI bahwa Persebaya sudah berusaha menjalankan secara maksimal pertandingan itu dengan baik, artinya dengan melibatkan ribuan pasukan keamanan dan sebagainya," sambungnya.

Hoping to Relieve Sanctions, Persebaya Officially Appeals to PSSI
Nov 04 2019, 19:25 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Persebaya Surabaya Management officially submitted an appeal to the PSSI Appeal Committee. Arek Suroboyo's pride team hopes that the sanctions will lighten on the riot incident in the counter-match against PSS Sleman.
Based on the PSSI committee's decision dated October 31, 2019, Persebaya received a penalty of playing without supporters until the end of the season. Green Force must also pay a fine of Rp. 200 million.
"Today we sent an appeal letter to the PSSI secretary general and also to the appeals commission," Persebaya Manager Chandra Wahyudi told Bola.net on Monday (11/04/2019).
Chandra said, in a memorandum of appeal, his party explained in detail the chronology of the riots. Including steps taken by management before and after the riots.
"First, the fact that there was a riot in the match against PSS, it cannot be denied, and the public is very aware and clear that there are indeed incidents of violence there," Chandra continued.
"Secondly, we explained to PSSI that Persebaya had tried to run the game optimally, meaning that it involved thousands of security forces and so on," he continued.
